verses.kjv: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
verses.ct: The LORD is my light and my salvation — who could I possibly be afraid of? The LORD is the fortress of my life — who could make me tremble?

verses.kjv: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.
verses.ct: When evil people, my enemies and opponents, attacked me to destroy me, they were the ones who tripped and collapsed.

verses.kjv: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.
verses.ct: Even if an entire army surrounded me, my heart would not be afraid. Even if war broke out against me, I would still be confident.

verses.kjv: One thing have I desired of the LORD, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the LORD, and to enquire in his temple.
verses.ct: There is one thing I have asked from the LORD, and it's what I will keep pursuing: to live in the LORD's house every day of my life, to gaze on the LORD's beauty, and to seek him in his temple.

verses.kjv: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.
verses.ct: In times of trouble, he will shelter me in his dwelling. He will conceal me in the safety of his tent. He will place me high on a rock.

verses.kjv: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Now my head will be held high above the enemies surrounding me. So I will bring joyful sacrifices to his tent. I will sing — yes, I will sing praises to the LORD.

verses.kjv: Hear, O LORD, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.
verses.ct: Listen to me, LORD, when I call out loud. Show me mercy and answer me.

verses.kjv: When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, LORD, will I seek.
verses.ct: When you said, 'Seek my presence,' my heart responded to you, 'Your presence, LORD, is what I will seek.'

verses.kjv: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
verses.ct: Don't withdraw your favor from me. Don't push your servant away in anger. You have always been my help — don't leave me or abandon me, God of my salvation.

verses.kjv: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the LORD will take me up.
verses.ct: Even if my father and mother abandon me, the LORD will take me in.

verses.kjv: Teach me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.
verses.ct: Show me your path, LORD, and guide me along a level road, because of those who oppose me.

verses.kjv: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.
verses.ct: Don't hand me over to the desires of my enemies, because lying witnesses have stood up against me, breathing out violence.

verses.kjv: I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
verses.ct: I would have lost all hope if I hadn't believed that I would see the LORD's goodness in the land of the living.

verses.kjv: Wait on the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the LORD.
verses.ct: Wait for the LORD. Be strong and take courage, and he will strengthen your heart. Wait, I tell you, for the LORD.
